perturbation.original_text:
Once every twelve (12)
months, 2TheMart through a CPA may inspect
and audit such records to verify reports.
Any such inspection will be conducted in a
manner that does not unreasonably interfere
with i-Escrow's business activities and with
no less than fifteen (15) days notice.
i-Escrow shall within two (2) weeks make any
overdue payments disclosed by the audit.
perturbation.changed_text:
Once every twenty-four (24)
months, 2TheMart through a CPA may inspect
and audit such records to verify reports.
Any such inspection will be conducted in a
manner that does not unreasonably interfere
with i-Escrow's business activities and with
no less than five (5) days notice.
i-Escrow shall within four (4) weeks make any
overdue payments disclosed by the audit.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows for annual audits with a 15-day notice period. The modified text changes this to audits every two years with only five days' notice, which could be considered an unreasonably short notice period, hindering i-Escrow's ability to prepare, potentially conflicting with standards of 'reasonable access' to records, or good faith practices depending on jurisdiction. Moreover, extending the payment period to four weeks after the audit finding could be considered an unreasonable delay in resolving discrepancies.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with California's implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing in contracts if the reduced notice period and extended payment period are deemed commercially unreasonable or designed to obstruct the audit process.

perturbation.original_text:
A party wishing to
renew this Agreement shall give the other
party notice thereof no less than thirty
(30) days before the expiration of the term
then in effect.  In the event that either
party does not give such notice, the term of
this Agreement shall be automatically
renewed for another one (1) year.
perturbation.changed_text:
A party wishing to
renew this Agreement shall give the other
party notice thereof no less than ten
(10) days before the expiration of the term
then in effect.  In the event that either
party does not give such notice, the term of
this Agreement shall be automatically
renewed for another one (1) year.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text reduces the renewal notice period from 30 days to 10 days. Depending on the nature of the agreement and industry standards, a 10-day notice period might be deemed insufficient, especially considering that the agreement is automatically renewed. This could be argued as a violation of good faith business practices as it doesn't allow sufficient time to evaluate the terms, ensure that it remains beneficial, and that all conditions are met before renewal.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with California's implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing if the reduced notice period is deemed unreasonably short.

perturbation.original_text:
Upon expiration or termination of
this Agreement, within fourteen (14) days of
the other party's request, each party will
return all Confidential Information and
other deliverables to the requesting party.
perturbation.changed_text:
Upon expiration or termination of
this Agreement, within thirty (30) days of
the other party's request, each party will
destroy all Confidential Information and
other deliverables to the requesting party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates the return of confidential information within 14 days of request upon termination. The modified text changes this to require destruction rather than return, and extends the deadline to 30 days. While seemingly minor, the requirement for destruction creates risk of non-compliance. The party that gets the confidential information could use it before the destruction deadline, and can hide it, which could also cause business ethics issues. A fourteen-day deadline would allow 2TheMart to review the documents that were returned and make sure there were no discrepancies, and that the confidential information had not been compromised.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with standards related to trade secret protection and fiduciary duties, or compliance requirements for data retention/destruction depending on the nature of confidential data involved and applicable regulations.
